Mandatory Route Adherence — Applicable in Confined Waters Near Port Areas; spatial anchor: Aalborg Harbor and Adjacent Shipping Lanes
Operational Protocol Rationale: In the dense network of named shipping lanes near Aalborg Harbor, vessels—particularly cargo ships of moderate size (100–150 m length, 8–10 m draught)—typically follow strictly defined, linear routes to ensure safe passage through confined and potentially congested waters. The observed stable speed, consistent course over ground, and minimal heading variation indicate the vessel is operating under autopilot along a regulated channel, where deviations are minimized for navigational safety. This behavior aligns with standard port approach procedures, which prioritize predictable, straight-line motion to reduce collision risk. Alternative behaviors involving turns or variable speed are less likely here due to the proximity to harbor infrastructure and the presence of multiple fixed maritime pathways, which constrain maneuvering options.
